newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Calgene, Quantum climb.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Calgene, Quantum climb.

text.p: Calgene Inc shares rose to 7-1/4 from 5-1/2 in pre-open trade Wednesday after Monsanto Co proposed last night the purchase of the 47 percent of Calgene it does not already own for $7.25 per share.
Also, Quantum Corp jumped to 35 from 33-1/8 before the bell on news of fiscal third quarter results that far exceeded Wall Street estimates.
The company, citing record sales of its computer disk drives, earned $0.71 per share in the period versus the $0.52 per share consensus analyst forecast.
Quantum posted a $0.05 per share loss one year ago.
Baan Co N.V.'s Nasdaq-listed shares climbed 3-3/8 to 45, appealing to investor with strong earings announced early this morning.
The Netherlands-based company said it earned US$0.17 per share in the fourth quarter, US$0.03 above the Wall Street consensus forecast compiled by Zack's Investment Research.
Baan netted US$0.07 one year ago.
3Com Corp rose to 62-7/8 from 61-1/4, a rise traders attributed to the company's conference call last with analysts yesterday.
In the talk, the company said December sales of networking products had weakened, but picked up in January.
Netscape Communications Corp added 1-3/4 to 39-3/4 after reporting fourth quarter earnings of $0.10 per share, up from $0.01 one year ago.
Also active preceding the open were Intel, up 1-5/8 to 152-5/8 and Microsoft, up to 96-5/8 from 95-3/4.
